page.title: 01The Wolds around Ulceby
page.content: The landscape is predominantly chalk downland rising to about 110m above datum, at its hightest. Deeply incised valleys, mainly dry (but with springs & wells in places) are the result of peri-glacial activity. Some "Glacial Till" forms a veneer on some hills; while ancient alluvium occupies elongated strips in valleys, & some hillsides. Woodlands are generally on glacial till. Settlement is small & scattered with about 180 people living or working in the area. Alford exerts an influence with its market craft market & limited industry. Farming & services are the main occupations although there is a woodyard cum builders' materials; & coffin-making in the former Chapel. The "Smithy" still functions but no longer shoes horses.
